The Dragon Age series is one of the best series I've played so far. I seriously recommend the three games in the trilogy. The characters are absolutely amazing, the story is very interesting, and the entire experience is unforgettable.
One of the best RPG games of all time, any gaming fan NEEDS to play this, and PC is the perfect platform for this masterpiece.

This game is one of the best RPG's in existence. It has a diverse cast of characters, each with their own unique look and personality. As the main character, you get to pick your race (human, dwarf, or elf), completely customize your appearence and skill set, and choose between several origin stories (hence the name of the game) for your character. Based on what you choose, NPC's have different reactions towards you. You can also recruit many companions throughout your travels, each packaged with their own backstory and personal quests. The voice acting in the game is pretty amazing. Each companion and major plot line character has a voice that is unique to them and easily recognizable.

Gameplay is great as well. While on easier difficulties, you can take whoever you want with you, click on an enemy, and easily win, it is far more complex on higher difficulties. The game uses a tactics system that makes your companions use their abilities to react to certain conditions. On a high difficulty, it is necessary to balance out your companions abilities and tactics to ensure that you will be ready for even the strongest of enemies. If you don't have good balance or don't plan your battles, you will likely be easily destroyed.

As far as graphics go, I will admit that this game isn't the best looking (but hey, it's five years old now, so it's pretty easy to overlook, and the other aspects of the game more than make up for it). However, Bioware has made this game easily moddable so there are many mods out there that can completely transform this game. I don't even know how many I have installed, but it's a lot!

Overall, this game is just a fantastic RPG with decent graphics, great story, unique characters, amazing voice acting, complex gameplay, and an amazing modding community. If you like RPGs and haven't played this yet,  THEN GET OFF YOUR BUTT AND GET THIS GAME.
Why are you reading these silly comments about this awesome game? Go play and experience the majesty that is Dragons Age for yourself.
my personal favorite rpg.

Oh wow, where should I start? Well first of all this is the third time I've owned the game, first on the Xbox 360, then again on the PS3, and finally on the PC.  Now this game is dated, it came out in 2009, and you can really see it when you play it.  Even cranking the graphics up to max on your pc won't do much to improve the apperance of the game.  However there are quite a few mods out there that tweak the appearance of the game, making it signficantly more pleasant, however I have not seen any total overhaul mod out there.  Do note that there is no Steam workshop for this game, but Nexus does include the Nexus Mod Manager, and has a very large selection of mods available for this game, so definitely check them out once you buy, and install this beast.

Now for the meat of things, Dragon Age Origins is the first game in the trilogy, and takes place in Ferelden, the fictional nation inspired largely by medieval England, as the on set of the Fifth Blight encroaches the land.  I do not want to spoil anything, so I'll avoid talking any more about the story, but I feel that at this point in time almost everyone has played this game or at least wikia'd the plot.  This game features the point and click style combat, as in I left click over my oponet and he begins to swing his sword, then I can press one of my hotkeyes for him to use a skill.  Do not come in expecting this to be like DA II or DAI, where you'll be spamming the attack button like a game of Dynasty Warriors.  Fortunately you have regenerating health outside of combat, and mages have a healing branch, something that Bioware took out of DAI, which drove me insane, especially on Hard and Nightmare difficulties.  In this game you'll often find yourself pausing combat so you can survey the battlefield, formulate  a plan, and then issue orders, then unpause to watch your four man/woman team move out.

Now I would definitely recommend playing this game on hard at least, to get a real challenge out of things, it definitely makes the game more enjoyable, and I practically live in pause mode/tactical mode.  The mechanics here are amazing, as you travel from area to area, you have a slight ability to explore each of these areas.  Now this is not a free roaming game, well not in the traditional sense at least.  You can control to which 'area' you want to go to, and within each area there is a small degree of exploration involved, but to me that was never important, seeing as how I was so engrossed by the story.  There's plenty of NPC's to talk to, a fair amount of side quests to do, and so much ♥♥♥♥ to pick up it isn't even remotely funny.

The Ultimate Edition also comes with all the DLC you could ever want, and the game has for that matter.  So you definitely get your money's worth, especially with the story expansion Awakening installed that (can) continue your journey after the completition of Origins.  Not to mention you have all of the smaller story/mission DLC's to play, that will take up a few hours of your time, answer some of your questions or give you some closure in some of them, as well as net you new items for your main game.  Oh yeah I forgot about the prologue story for Leliana, entitled Leliana's Song, which takes place before Origins, lets you play as Leliana, and also gets you some cool items to use in Origins (especially for Leliana!).

This game is amazing, it has so much content, gameplay is fantastic, the story will keep you hooked and playing until the sun comes back up, and you'll know why this game is the best of the trilogy.  Plus you'll establish such unhealthy connections with some of the characters you might end up getting a body pillo...uh you'll just try to learn everything about them.  Also the game gets better with mods, they're like swear words and spices, it makes things better.  Plus it'll help clean up the appearance of the game a little bit.  Personally I love this game, it's in my top 5 games of all times, and it's better then those other two, and it has a better ending than Mass Effect 3.  This game is a 10/10, you wont find a better game with as much content for this price with access to thousands of mods that make it even better.  Plus it has a story better then the entire Elder Scrolls universe.

Even Commander Shepard would tell you that this is his favorite game on all of Steam, I mean at least believe him, he is the first human SPECTRE, savior of the galaxy, human icon, and an all around great guy.
Better than Inquisition. This is a game any RPG lover should already own.

A good RPG, but can get very tedious. It's certainly worth a play if you've never touched it, but despite its multiple origin stories it's not really worth another playthrough.

reviewText: My fav game of all time, this game is great! No reason not to get this.

Dragon Age: Origins and I have a complex history. When it first came out, I wasn't interested. It wasn't until a good friend of mine pushed me over and over to give it a shot that I finally tried, and though it took me a few hours to get into it, once I did, I found one of the most rewarding RPG experiences I've had to date. With a huge, sprawling, living world and tons of lore and choices to make, if you're a fan of western RPGs, it's hard to go wrong with DA:O. I will mention that the combat is real time with pause tactical combat, so don't be caught off guard if you don't like that kind of thing. It never really bothered me. Oh, and word to the wise: The second game is nowhere near as good, so be prepared for that as well.

Aside from the fact that some of the character animations are a bit awkward, and BioWare's philosophy on sexual intercourse involves keeping undergarments on, Dragon Age is a pretty awesome guy. Arguably the last, true high-quality BioWare RPG. The tactical micromanagement of both your characters and combat in addition to a tremendous amount of backstory within party members and the world around you puts Origins high up on my all-time favorite RPGs. I also have to give credit to the dialogue system, which actually gives players more than 3 progressing options and acknowledges the existence of moral grey areas. And, of course, it wouldn't be a BioWare game without sexy fun time, so there's that too. You also get a dog as a party member. His name is Dogniel Craig.\n\nUE is a lot of game. Like, A LOT of ♥♥♥♥ing game. The main campaign alone is relatively beefy, and on top of that, you've got all the DLC campaigns. Fair warning that a lot of 'epics' like Origins may take a while to really kick in, unfortunately. The beginning content is by no means bad, but it certainly takes its time to set up the whole grand adventure with Darkspawn, politics, and Morrigan's panties. But if you got a lot of time to kill, this will do it. I give it 9 10/10s.

I cannot say enough good things about Dragon Age: Origins. The storyline, soundtrack, characters.... all of it. It is a masterpiece. reviewText:
Want a good computer RPG that isn't too dumbed down despite being relatively new? Look no further, you've found it.

Great combat, great dialogue, good lore, some cool bosses, etc.

The only complaint I have is that the world feels somewhat instanced. It doesn't feel very open and it's split up by a lot of loading screens.

But yes, overall I will give it a 9.5. A truly amazing gem. Worth picking up if you like games like Baldur's Gate 2, Neverwinter Nights, or just want some amazing tactical combat.

There's also a good amount of mods available on the Nexus page that further improve the game, even though it's great without any mods; unlike some other RPGs (*cough* Skyrim *cough*)
I'm not saying this is the greatest RPG of all time.....but it is.

One of the best games I've ever played and the best fantasy RPG since Baldur's Gate 2. I highly recommend both Dragon Age: Origins and the Awakening expansion to anyone who enjoys a well thought out and engaging plot, great in-game dialogue, and fun party members along with Bioware's well refined combat system used in Knights of the Old Republic.

Even though I have a low amount of hours on PC, I had hundreds of hours on the Xbox360. Still worth playing a few run throughs every now and again, plus DLCs are cool. Id recommend to any Elder Scrolls fans or just RPG in general.

Dragon Age Origins Ultimate Edition consists of an interesting combat system, rich story along with DLC to only add to the immersive gameplay experience. Origins has an unique RPG experience with the feel of a true RPG.
There are many game changing decisions that change the your gameplay! You venture through the magnificent lands of Ferelden with your party at your back. You have the power of choice and with that power you choice the fate of not only your venture but of your party's.
Origin's combat system is something that standout with its unique twist of features that aren't see in many RPGs these days. The combat consist of the many possibilities to pause the game mid fight to make those tactical life saving power moves to save the life of your party!
There is so many features in this game to make it so unique in so many ways that it must be experienced by one's self.

You will not find an RPG as hardcore as this one in the single player arena of game for some time. Don't hesitate buy and play this game!

One of the best Strategy game.  Great action along with story.  This game requires alot of microing and battle planning.  The best thing about it, is that you can play every single class and there are minimal restrictions of what you can do.  You just got to simply know how to play every role of the characters available and maximize those characters potientail.  Make sure you got a well balance team of  tank / healer / dps.  This game will catch your interest from the start to till end.
Dragon Age is by far one of my favorite RPG games. If you enjoyed Neverwinter Nights, Dungeon Siege, or Baldurs Gate you should give this game a shot.

Addicting game worth buying on the cheap. I haven't played turn-based roleplaying games since the original release of Neverwinter Nights, but I picked this up on a sale and I can't stop thinking about it. However, coming from an RPG hiatus, the combat system needs work. Often I'm grinding mobs without strategy, and the challenge in battles is tempermental. Sometimes it's a breeze, and sometimes I'm destroyed in seconds. The learning curve for the tactics system and all the available skills can be high, but I don't discount user error. Would have loved more of an introduction or a large community focused on min-maxing tactic combinations. In all, great game. Can't wait for Inquisition.

A great RPG with a amazing story and fun combat. Go where ever you want and get a pet dog, or kill a crazy old mage in the woods and then help a old tree! If you like rpgs and you don't have this game WHAT ARE YOU WATING FOR. I give it a 9/10!
Loved the story line and the sass between the characters.  Fun and enjoyable.

Great game with good story, nice interaction and conversations but hard to get mechanics; extremely easy or impossible enemies, nothing in between. AI of party members is so stupid, random action would be better. Still a freakin' awesome game.

Recently decided to pick up the ultimate edition of this game, having owned the physical copy of the original since the year that DA:O came out. Altogether I've probably spent over 200 hours into this game and if you were to do a full playthrough inculding all the DLC and the explansion you might be looking at around 70 hours of immersive gameplay. Origins in itself is largely about what race/class combo you choose and subsequently throughtout the game you will experience different interactions that promote the game's replay value. So in my opinion it's well worth the money these days.

However having never tried the Awakening expansion before, I was surprised by how easy it was even on the hardest difficulty compared to the original game. To me if felt like your hero—if you choose to import from origins—is too well geared at that point and has way too many skills attributes, to the point where often I couldn't even find a place to spend points to maintain my builds later in the game. And add the fact that companions were not so fleshed out in the expansion through things like specific character stories and conversations, you will be surprised at the transition from the base game to the expansion.

Nonetheless the base DA:O game is a RPG that I would recommend to all who are interested in a unique pause-combat system in addition to a great fantasy story.
Why are you reading these silly comments about this awesome game? Go play and experience the majesty that is Dragons Age for yourself.
my personal favorite rpg.
Want magic, sex, funny dialogue, and all around awesome? Play Dragon Age, it will rock your socks.

If have not played this game and you are deciding if you should. Just do it. This game is so amazing I doubt you will actually regret it. Even though I have beat it I can still come back to the game and have fun. Also if you liked the baldurs gate series I assure you that you will love this game.

the plot of Dragon Age is extremely rich with details that unfold over dozens of hours of play. All of this is documented in your in-game codex, which tracks conversations, plot points and other elements of your journey. The general backstory revolves around the Darkspawn threat to the land of Ferelden. Darkspawn are a race of creatures born from magic users who attempted to become gods, but were cursed for their efforts. Led by the powerful Arch-demon, the beasts emerge from underground lairs every few hundred years in a swarming plague known as the Blight.\n
Great game

I got this 'Ultimate Edition' for £5... Possibly the best money I have ever spent!

I have around 26 hours on record so far and have not even scratched the surface. I had played Dragon Age 2 on console and no idea that this bargain would be by far superior to it's sequel.

Depth, lots and lots of depth. Voice acting, for the most part, is superb. Every companion has bags of personality (for better or worse), the storyline is gripping without making you feel like you should rush through the main quests, environments have obviously been lovingly created to the point where it feels like you're in a world that's had as much TLC as one created by Tolkien himself.

All of this and I'm 13% of the way to completing the game... It's going to be a good ride :)

MUST BUY!
love of my life sun of my sky, 11/10 would bang again
First day - LOVE IT!\n\nBuy it ^^

To anyone who loves RPGs you have to try this out. The game is well executed, beautifully scripted, supports extended tactics in battle and the story is beyond belief! The characters available as party members you come across throughout the game are so beautifully written, you don't want to finish the game simply due to the fact that you'd have to leave your party behind.

And the romance.. oh don't get me started on the romance.. <3
Gaider and co., you are my heroes

The perfect game for new parents!  I can hold Baby in one hand and play the game with the other (since almost all the controls can be done completely by using only the mouse)!  Note: cover Baby's eyes during certain scenes.  Darkspawn are scary, and some demons aren't well clothed :(  For shame!\n\nEdit: I've been playing this game over and over again for years.  I love it.  I wish there were more games like this.  I've played KOTOR and KOTOR:TSL ad nauseum as well.  I will be putting many more hours into this game.

not bad.

I know a large amount of people that have played DA, but never got round to it until late last year. Let me tell you this: best decision ever. I love the gameplay, there's so much to do, 30 hours in and I'm only 14% complete. I enjoy the interaction between the characters, and how every choice you make determines the kind of person your character becomes. I started out as a Dalish Elf, a pretty serene race far from any outside contact, and now I'm assassinating people and chose to romance Zefran. The game gives you so many options every step of the way, the only downside is, I really want to move on to the next one! Guess I'll have to be patient, because I want to see this through as far as I can.

Great game with good story, nice interaction and conversations but hard to get mechanics; extremely easy or impossible enemies, nothing in between. AI of party members is so stupid, random action would be better. Still a freakin' awesome game.

Recently decided to pick up the ultimate edition of this game, having owned the physical copy of the original since the year that DA:O came out. Altogether I've probably spent over 200 hours into this game and if you were to do a full playthrough inculding all the DLC and the explansion you might be looking at around 70 hours of immersive gameplay. Origins in itself is largely about what race/class combo you choose and subsequently throughtout the game you will experience different interactions that promote the game's replay value. So in my opinion it's well worth the money these days.

However having never tried the Awakening expansion before, I was surprised by how easy it was even on the hardest difficulty compared to the original game. To me if felt like your hero—if you choose to import from origins—is too well geared at that point and has way too many skills attributes, to the point where often I couldn't even find a place to spend points to maintain my builds later in the game. And add the fact that companions were not so fleshed out in the expansion through things like specific character stories and conversations, you will be surprised at the transition from the base game to the expansion.

Nonetheless the base DA:O game is a RPG that I would recommend to all who are interested in a unique pause-combat system in addition to a great fantasy story.

I really enjoyed this game. It was a new game from Bioware in an updated and improved style of the old Neverwinter Nights games. The graphics were a bit clunky for the time that it came out, but it was nice to be able to have abilities that complimented or were fueled off of each other. You could play the game focused on one character or play it like a turn based tactical game. I thought the relationships system was very heavy handed, and largely lame, but you didn’t have to engage in it. Unfortunately Bioware continued experimenting with the system for several more of their games. I enjoyed the game so much that I bought it for several of my friends.\n\nI had more fun playing as a mage than the other classes. I also bought the second game having hopes that it would be a more improved version of DA:O, but they went the wrong way with it making it more of a hack 'n slash action/rpg - so avoid that title. I've beaten this game twice, once vanilla on the 360 and once on the PC - all but the last dlc.
This is such a classic game! I love the role-playing, all the different decisions you can make, and of course, Alistair!

I had actually initially owned Dragon Age: Origins for the Xbox, but the system died and a year or two passed and I DL'd it for the PC through Steam. If you are a completionist like me, this game is going to take a toll on you. There are a LOT of options and I don't necessarily know that it's possible to play every possible combination. That being said, if you are looking for a dark fantasy RPG, this is probably a good on. Set in aerial 3/4 view (not unlike diablo) the game handles easily. I wished it was an FPS RPG like the Elder Scrolls games, but it's not too bad. The combat is relatively simple, and the story is extremely immersive. If you like an RPG that really allows you to carve out a character an delve into their choices as the world around you forms based on it. Play this game.
So ♥♥♥♥ing cool. Love it so much.

Even though I have a low amount of hours on PC, I had hundreds of hours on the Xbox360. Still worth playing a few run throughs every now and again, plus DLCs are cool. Id recommend to any Elder Scrolls fans or just RPG in general.
I'm not saying this is the greatest RPG of all time.....but it is.

DA:O is an incredibly fun tactical squad-based RPG. The story is solid and character decisions make a HUGE difference, especially as you can import your save from DA:O into Dragon Age 2, and then into Dragon Age: Inquisition. The gameplay is just as strong, featuring a simple, easy-to-use dialogue system and a robust combat system, replete with AI tactics which can somewhat automate the process of managing 4 characters in a combat environment.\n\nTL;DR - If you like RPG games with meaningful player decisions (e.g., not what Skyrim does with meaningless player decisions) and don't mind an over-the-shoulder/bird's-eye-view approach to a tactically-grounded squad-based combat game, then this is the game for you!
One of the best RPGs of our time

Honestly I'm reviewing this more for the extra content the core game itself. I had already played dragon age before but none of the dlcs or awakening. Dragon age is a fantastic game for those who enjoy fantasy rpgs with turn based fighting. The world is beautiful, the story is detailed, the characters are colorful and a long game to enjoy every single moment. If you like the Kotor games then you'd like this. The DLC's were fun but as normal they are quite short. You have Leilana's song to learn about her background. Darkspawn invasion allowes you to enjoy being a darkspawn. Shale is a great add on character. Return to Ostagar and Wardens keep are decent small maps. Awakening is very well done with tons of new skills. Witch hunt is decent but short. The Golems of Angnarok is good but the final boss is way to hard in my opinion. All in all, a great series and I had a ton of fun replaying again. Fantasy RPGs are my all time favorites and this one will be included there.

One of the best games I've ever played, the storyline and the World of Thedas is rich and entertaining, as well as immensely fun. Your companions are all intriguing in their own ways and I've played the game so many times just to experience the world over and over.\n\n10/10.

Very good game.  I did a full playthrough of the base game, DLC, and expansion when I had it for the PS3.  A very cool story, good combat.  You can also pause the game to tell your characters what to do in advance, if you're not able to keep up with the combat normally.  It's a pretty challenging game, and it has a ton of content even without the DLC and expansion.  The character customization I feel could've been a bit better but it's good enough.  Meet lots of interesting characters, and travel around with 3 other characters of your choosing as you meet them along the way.\n\nAt times you will have to make some important decisions, which is always fun to see in a game.  Things that happen in this game are supposed to change the world of Dragon Age 2, though from what I have heard Dragon Age 2 was a big dissapointment.  Still, this is worth playing.  One of the best out there!

reviewText: Though its now dated and now the first in a series, I still feel that this game is the best. The characters are fun, the stories are amazing, the voice acting sublime. Its one of those 100% games. Well it would be if it were easier to mod.

Want to play Mass Effect but with magic and swords instead of space-tech and guns?

Dragon Age brings to life a dark fantasy full of world altering decisions, the most important of which is...

WHO DO I ROMANCE?!

One of the greatest RPG's in terms of lore, story, choices, atmosphere and setting; from the amazing bioware you would expect no less. On par with Mass Effect, DA:O recieved a lot less funding than ME did, and only recieved proper attention from Bioware when the ME triology finished, with DA: Inquisition. While Inquisition is the best RPG in the DA series, Origins is by far the essential bit when it comes to ultimate lore and story, even the DLCs are just intensely mind blowingly epic (the architect). Story for me is one of the best things a game can deliver on, especially when it comes to background stories (lore) and making your own personal choices to decide on the path of that story. Origins was never the ebst gameplay wise, however if you can man-up and appreciate the low-budget gameplay downfalls versus story, lore and everything epic, it's a worth while investment. DA2 was awful, but provided some key bits of lore for DA lore fanboys such as myself and fangirls (good ones on youtube). DA:I might be the best starting point if you can't cope with tragic gameplay of the first 2, however many consider DA2 the entry point of the series, as it's extremely simplisitc (good for casual gamers like my girlfriend).\nThere's many games with good stories and lore, but never has a game made me want to read every snippet that pops up in the text like it has in DA. Skyrim books not for me, DA books and side quests are for me. Bought the books it was so good.

reviewText: Great story, high replayability an instant classic.

A great story driven adventure with multiple characters and ending options, with all the DLC story packs to ensure that you get the full experience of working your team to be heroes of Thedas. As well as being a great introduction to the series as a whole and easy to understand role playing machinics allowing a good range of gamers to play, if old but decent graphics are okay with you then this is the game you may enjoy to see what outcome you can create for Thedas itself.
This game is god damn incredible!

I did the Dalish elf origin story and I was a female Warden. I befriended all of the possible companions and I ended up having a relationship with Alistair until the end.

I absolutely loved this game! So many ways how you can develop your character and how your choices massively influence what happens later on, it's brilliant. The fighting is interesting and diverse because you have ranged or melee weapons and then you also have special tricks for mages, rogues or warriors. Especially if you walk around with companions who are a different class, life is really exciting in Ferelden.

The conversation options are absolutely brilliant. I like the fighting and the quests just fine, but I adore proper character development and relationship building. So many options and opportunities, it was really great fun.

If you want to play this game on 100%, be careful and maybe read in the Dragon Age Wiki beforehand. This game has a few bugs which may lead to you not being able to finish certain quests at specific points in the game.
Pretty much the ultimate single player fantasy RPG. The writing is good, the NPCs engaging and the action plentiful.
This is without a doubt my favorite video game of all time. If you like story focused games, intricate fantasy worlds, and diverse characters then you need to own this game.

My favorite game of all time, truely a masterpiece. The combat can take a little getting used to, especially if you come from an action game background. But you'll be absorbed by this game by it's loveable characters, interesting story, and incredible setting. Finished this game on my ps3 years ago and bought  it on steam just to play it again.

reviewText: The game is awesome. But 4 years ago it was the exact same price as now, what the hell?

I think this has to be one of my favorite games ever ( Others being No More Heroes, Wind Waker, Psychonauts, Resident Evil 4, Team Fortress 2, Persona 3, Half Life 2, and Tales of Symphonia)

The graphics look good ( textures are a bit more wonkier though), The gameplay is preety addicting, your characters are varied and go through growth and changes throughout the game, and the game's lore has to be the first video game lore I may actually master.

Runs well ( Though it is from like 2008). You should easily play this. One of he best RPGs I've ever played ( May even do a REPLAY! And I almost NEVER do those!)

Overall, Dragon Age: Origins is a very diverse game. After completing my first playthough in around 60 hours, I began my second run through the game, and had a completely different experience. The best part is though, I looked at my 'Heroic Accomplishments' and found to my delight that I had only expeienced 43% of the game.

Final Verdict:
10/10

my favorite game of all time, and i have played a lot of games, from all platforms. the game has aged well, and even tho characters may look ugly at times, it gives the world a more immersive feeling.\n\ntoo bad games dont come out often with this type of roleplaying quality. playing multiple playthroughs is even worth it with this game because of the companions, and how you get to treat them. this series is the best example of how adding voice to your main character can be a bad idea.
Top quality RPG here. Hours of entertainment to complete all the quests. Replayable as different races and classes have different routes to success.
